src:
Gempa Kedua Guncang Filipina, Apartemen Sewaan WNI Roboh
02 Nov 2019, 20:21 by Retno M


Gempa Kedua Guncang Filipina, Apartemen Sewaan WNI Roboh

KBRN, Jakarta : Gempa bumi kedua yang mengguncang Filipina dengan skala magnitudo (M), 6,8, Kamis pagi (31/10/2019), berdampak pada warga negara Indonesia (WNI) yang berdomisili di kota Davao, yang terletak di pulau Mindanao, Filipina Selatan. Pusat gempa bumi sendiri diketahui berada di pulau Mindanao.
Kepala Penerangan, humas dan media Kedutaan Besar RI (KBRI) Manila, Agus Buana, mengatakan bahwa, WNI terdampak gempa bumi tersebut merupakan staf Konsulat Jenderal RI (KJRI) Davao, dimana apartemen tempat tinggalnya roboh ketika gempa terjadi.
“Hanya ada 1 WNI (korban), yaitu staf KJRI Davao yang apartemennya lantai 1 dan 2 roboh, sedangkan yang bersangkutan tinggal di lantai 3,” papar Agus Buana dalam keterangan tertulisnya kepada RRI, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Menurut Agus, saat ini staf KJRI tersebut beserta keluarga ditampung di gedung KJRI Davao.
“Sekarang di tampung di KJRI Davao,” imbuhnya.
Lebih lanjut Agus menambahkan, robohnya apartemen akibat gempa bumi, juga menyebabkan staf dan keluarga mengalami trauma.
“(Mengalami) trauma,” jelas Agus.
Sementara, sebelumnya gempa pertama di pulau Mindanao, Filipina, Selasa, 29 Oktober 2019 juga terjadi dengan skala magnitudo 6,6 dan tidak ada WNI yang terdampak. Sedangkan, jumlah WNI di pulau Mindanao mencapai 2763 orang. (Foto : dok.Liputan6)
text:
Second Earthquake Rattles the Philippines, WNI Rental Apartment Collapsed
02 Nov 2019, 20:21 by Retno M


Second Earthquake Rattles the Philippines, WNI Rental Apartment Collapsed

KBRN, Jakarta: The second earthquake that shook the Philippines on a magnitude (M) scale, 6.8, Thursday morning (10/31/2019), impacted Indonesian citizens (WNI) domiciled in the city of Davao, located on the island of Mindanao , Southern Philippines. The epicenter itself is known to be on the island of Mindanao.
The Head of Information, PR and media of the Indonesian Embassy in Manila, Agus Buana, said that the Indonesian citizen affected by the earthquake was a staff member of the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao, where his apartment had collapsed when the earthquake occurred.
"There is only 1 citizen (victim), namely staff of the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao whose apartment on the 1st and 2nd floor collapsed, while the person concerned lives on the 3rd floor," said Agus Buana in his written statement to RRI, Saturday (11/02/2019).
According to Agus, the Indonesian Consulate General and his family are currently accommodated in the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao.
"Now it is accommodated in the Indonesian Consulate General in Davao," he added.
Agus further added, the collapse of the apartment due to the earthquake, also caused staff and family trauma.
"(Experiencing) trauma," explained Agus.
Meanwhile, before the first earthquake on the island of Mindanao, Philippines, Tuesday, October 29, 2019 also occurred with a magnitude of 6.6 and no citizens were affected. Meanwhile, the number of Indonesian citizens on the island of Mindanao reached 2763 people. (Photo: doc. Cover6)
